text: it's hard for me not to make food videos
while living in Bangkok because every
corner you turn is another night slicing
something juicy or a pushcart selling
something spicy but what makes Thai food
so good from a geographical perspective
Thailand benefits from being located
between China India Malaysia Indonesia
among others taking in influences from
each traditional Thai food has a
combination of four key tastes sweet
salty sour and bitter and many popular
dishes have refined recipes that have
been handed down over generations
coconut is a staple ingredient that's
found in many meals
along with ginger chilli lemongrass and
fresh vegetables and of course rice or
noodles is usually included as I'm
getting really into the ins and outs of
Thai food I decided to learn how to cook
my favourite dish of all green curry
I found a cooking class on KK day and we
did it all from scratch we first went to
a market to get fresh ingredients we
grabbed some chicken spices fresh
vegetables and then we headed into the
studio feels like someone's house to
start cooking and learning from our
friendly teacher first step hand mixed a
green curry paste
Chuy's shallots garlic lemongrass lime
peppercorns cilantro salt shrimp paste
and pound it all together
imagine you can add coconut cream
eggplants basil leaves more chillies and
watch it all sizzle on the pan it smells
really good
let it ooze down slowly into the bowl
and there you have my favorite meal in
Thailand absolute perfect ice cream curd
ever had because you made it I made it
it's hard for me to pick a favorite
cuisine in the world but if I had to
narrow it down
Thai food would be at the very top I'm
drew pinsky and if you like my travel
videos please click Subscribe and join
me as I plan to visit every country in
the world
